creator: bill.seddon@lyquidity.com
text:
The sheet variable gridset can be null when this function is called via 
HSSFWorksheet.isGridsPrinted().  Because there is no error detection in the 
method, an exception is generated.

Adding the line:

if (gridset == null) gridset = (GridsetRecord)createGridset();

before the return statement will address the problem though I've no idea if 
this a valid thing to do.
creator: bill.seddon@lyquidity.com

text:
Sheet.gridset field was not being set when the sheet was created from an
existing workbook.

If the Sheet.isGridsPrinted is called and there is no gridset then one is created.

Fix committed in SVN.
creator: jheight@apache.org
